666: Responsibilities: About Temecula Valley Hospital Temecula Valley Hospital (TVH), brings advanced technology, innovative programs, patient-centered and family sensitive care to area residents featuring 140 private patient rooms. TVH is a Comprehensive Stroke Center and the first Universal Health Services Hospital Emergency Department in the country to achieve accreditation from the American College of Emergency Physicians (ACEP) as a Geriatric Emergency Department. TVH, with a 4 Star Medicare Hospital Compare rating, specializes in advanced cardiac services and stroke care, general and surgical specialties, and orthopedics as a recent Blue Distinction® Center Designation for Quality in Knee and Hip Replacement Surgeries. TVH is nationally recognized for Patient Safety by the Leapfrog Group, with a 2020 and 2017 Top Hospital Award and nine ‘A’ Grades for Patient Safety. For more information, please visit https://www.temeculavalleyhospital.com/about/news Security Guard The Temecula Valley Hospital Security Guard is responsible for protecting life and property of all persons on the hospital premises. Primary duties include patrolling buildings and grounds of the hospital to prevent fires, theft and vandalism. Essential Job Duties : The Security Guard is responsible for inspecting doors, windows, and locks to determine level of security. Ensures only authorized personnel are admitted onto hospital premises. Escorts visitors, patients and personnel to and from parking areas with consideration for age specific needs. Patrols parking areas to detect any irregularities. Responds to emergency calls for assistance to control disorderly conduct or combative patients and demonstrates age specific responses in these situations. Inspects outgoing parcels as necessary to prevent theft of hospital property.
